author: Staff Reporter
text:
It has been set up at a cost of Rs. 94.50 lakh in Vadaseri

Chief Minister Jayalalithaa inaugurated a fish market complex constructed at an estimated cost of Rs. 94.50 lakh near Christopher bus stand in Vadaseri in Nagercoil through videoconferencing from Chennai on Saturday.

The fish market has 56 stalls, a fish processing facility, a fish cleaning shed, an overhead tank with a capacity of 60,000 litres, toilets and parking facilities.

The market was constructed with the financial assistance of Rs. 85.5 lakhs from the National Fisheries Development Board (NFDB) by the Department of Municipal Administration and Water Supply.

Immediately after the Chief Minister inaugurated the market complex, Collector Sajjansingh R. Chavan lighted the traditional lamp in the presence of former minister N. Thalavai Sundaram, MLAs K.T. Pachaimal, A. Nanjil Murugesan.

Tamil Nadu State Fisheries Cooperative Federation Chairman M. Xavier Manoharan, Nagercoil Municipality Chairman Meena Dev and representatives of local bodies were present on the occasion.

The Kanyakumari District Meen Thozhilalar Sangam had appealed to the municipal authorities not to hike the rent for the stalls in the market.

Rally

They took out a rally few months ago from fish market to the municipal office and held a demonstration to press their demands.

Market houses 56 stalls, fish processing facility, fish cleaning shed, an overhead tank
title: CM inaugurates fish market complex
